I have never used paint.net, I use GIMP for my texturing needs, but I imagine its about the same.

Best way i could think of to do that is make original texture a bottom layer at 0% transparent. Make the camo texture an upper layer and make it a tiny bit transparent(maybe start at like 20% and go up slowly till it looks good), then merge the camo layer down onto the original texture.

Honestly though textures is the aspect of modding I struggle with most, so there may be a better way I am to noob to know about.
I've succesfully created my camo texture thanks to KhaosCorp (and learned something new).
Twiddle with your blend modes when you do this, you may like the results better than the default additive blend.
